features: 100% ORGANIC COTTON: Tampons made from 100% certified organic cotton – because what you put in your body matters. Made without pesticides, dioxins, rayon, or chlorine; free of fragrance and dyes. FSA/HSA Eligible.
NEW PLANT-BASED APPLICATOR: Sleek, plant-based* compact applicator made from renewable resources for smooth, comfortable insertion. *minimum 92% plant-based plastic

EXPANDS AND PROTECTS: Gently expands to absorb from all angles for a worry-free, comfortable fit and ultra reliable leak protection –so you can roll with your flow. All absorbencies available for light to heavy flows: Light, Regular, Super, Super Plus, and Variety Packs.

EVERY BODY DESERVES COMFORT: We believe everyone should have access to period care–full stop. So, with each Cora purchase, we provide period products and body literacy resources to people who might otherwise go without.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It just makes me feel better to use cotton
reviews.reviewText: I never really considered what type of tampons I have been using until recently and seeing all the stories of women having issues with non organic brands scared me. I have a light period so I dont go through that many but some women go through like an entire box per period and that's crazy how much time a product spends in your body. I really like this product and the applicator is okay not great but that's fine.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Let me address the reasons these tampons are rated low by some.
reviews.reviewText: Let me first start off by saying this: I have tried many different brands of organic cotton tampons. Off the top of my head, I’d say it’s been around 5 or 6 different brands.Before I ever switched to organic cotton tampons, I did use tampax. That was years ago.A couple of the reviews on here are complaining about the leaks and comparing them to Tampax.Please allow me to address these two reasons people are rating this brand low.I don’t personally see a difference in these tampons than the other organic cotton ones I’ve used. The issues I’ve had with other organic cotton tampons are the same ones (mostly) that I’ve had with these. The biggest? That the super size still needs to be changed very frequently during the first (sometimes second) day of my period. It does leak, it doesn’t absorb much, BUT all the organic tampons that I’ve used (that I can remember) have been that way.Is it because they’re organic? I don’t know. Could it be because they’re just cotton and do not have all sorts of other harmful materials in them? Possibly.Which brings me to my next point. Stop comparing organic cotton tampons to the terrible-filled-with-synthetic-and-who-knows-what-else-fibers tampon brand. I mean, really. That’s dumb. Either decide you’re going to make the switch because you want something better for your body, or be quiet and stay with your artificial tampon so you can go 6 hours without changing it.I rated these a five because i freaking love the light absorbency tampons they have. For me, those are perfect near the end of my cycle, when I don’t need a regular tampon, but still need something. I’d usually just wear a panty liner, but I prefer tampons.I am going to try the super plus next time to see if it adsorbs better.Either way, I’ll never go back to synthetic fiber-filled tampons.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Only brand I use now
reviews.reviewText: Most other brands of tampons are itchy. These are not. However, I do have to change them a little more frequently.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I try my best to eliminate toxicity whenever I can. I decided to give the cora brand a try and I have been mostly satisfied. The applicator did take some getting used to as you have to be very intention when you are using it to make sure that you properly insert. I learned to squeeze the applicator when using it to make sure that the cotton portion is deployed correctly. I have had no issues with leaks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: These are by far one of my favorite tampon brands, because they are safe to use a non-toxic. They also go in very easily and are comfortable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Clean, organic, comfortable. A great improvement from their first design. In a pinch I have to use other brands which only instill my love for Cora.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Best organic tampon, but it’s still pretty bad.
reviews.reviewText: I used to wear regular tampons before I realized how much unnecessary BS & chemicals are in them, so I decided to switch to organic. I’ve tried several different brands, and so far Cora seems to be the best on the market in terms of organic tampons.Although, they are still not that great. There is pretty much zero leak protection. If I’m going to wear these I have to wear a panty liner with it because they leak that much. At that point I might as well wear a pad. I thought maybe I was leaving them in for too long (I normally have them in for 4 hours at a time) so I started wearing them for less I went to 2 hours before changing.. still leaking.. an hour.. still leaking. I by no means have a heavy flow period, but I have to wear the heaviest flow tampon and it still leaks! What’s the point of wearing a tampon if it’s going to leak so much? I’m going through way more tampons in a day then I should be. Also, the ratio for light, regular and heavy tampons is super off. Why so many light? What’s the point in even using light if the heavy flow can’t handle a normal period? These tampons don’t absorb anything!Aside from the poor absorption/leaking issue.. the applicator is awful and the string is far too long. Although, this issue is minor compared to the last and I can deal with this.I can say that these tampons are comfortable to wear and my cramps aren’t nearly as bad as compared to when I’m wearing a non-organic tampon.But.. the leaking. I can’t handle the leaking. If the tampon can’t absorb more then a dime of liquid and there is constant leaking.. it completely defeats the purpose of even wearing a tampon in the first place. And like I said, I don’t have a heavy flow period by any means. I’d say my flow is light-moderate. But I still have to wear the heavy tampons and they still leak, and I’m still constantly changing them.Can we like.. please get an organic tampon that actually absorbs anything and doesn’t leak?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Love these, but the packaging is terrible. Doesn’t look like anything is ruined except the box though :)
